user_text: Been here twice. It's kind of run down but it's got this cozy feeling like you know you're going to get good old diner food. It's a bit dark inside too. I've had both lunch and breakfast. The burger was nothing really special and kind of bland. The breakfast was top notch. Both times the food came out super quick too, ready in just over 5 min. A little over priced for what you're getting but the portions are a nice size.
Great breakfast, quick and tasty. The prices are fair as well. Parking is difficult as you would expect in the heights but if you get there early it's not too bad.

Truly disappointing,  my husband and I came across this place and I wish I hadn't.  We came in and was told to just sit which is cool.  There was a booth that stated only 3 or more ppl and the other booth available was literally next to the bathroom.  We were eventually seated in the booth for 3ppl. The waiter left and for about 5 minutes we went in noticed.  An older woman came from behind me and asked " what you drinking" as if me seating here was annoying her. She got our drinks and the got who sat is initially must have remembered us and yelled what did we want to drink. I let her know it was being taken care of.  She came back gave us our drinks I ordered French toast eggs hard she abruptly corrected me as if my description was incorrect.  My husband ordered an omelet and he asked for home fries her attitude was nasty she barked they come with fried them and toast what else.  We waited 10 or more minutes for just that, granted there was only one cook not one time did she come back to tell us it'll be ready shortly. She spoke ill of her co-workers to other guest.  By far the worst service I've experienced here.  I can understand maybe the locals or the ppl who frequent like this type of attitude but if she realized according to her that she was too old to be doing this she needs to stop because the way she spoke to customers on the phone and treated us her waitressing days should have been over.  Oh and the food was drenched in grease I had a hair in my eggs , his cheese in his omelet wasn't melted but due to her nasty attitude I wasn't in the mood for more had I complained.
Love this place. Very diner vibe. Everything I have ordered from breakfast to gyros have been great. I just took a star off since it should be open later as it is a diner.

Some of the very best whole in the wall. The food is very delicious and you definitely  get way more bang for your buck compared to other places to eat. The service was impeccable. As soon as walked in they seated me right away. You have to try the Greek omelette with extra feta cheese. Soooo goooood.
Great that there is a diner in this part of town, great diner, and unlike most places in the area in that it still gives a lot of food lol.

HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS PLACE!  Went here after a night out and the food and service was amazing.    ! I got the gyro platter deluxe and the corn beef hash and the food was cooked to perfection.  The lamb was seasoned well and the side salad was soo fresh. The service was friendly and i felt like i was in my own house. The waitress and the cashier greeted me with a smile and made sure my hangover finished course smoothly. HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS PLACE!!

My husband got scrambled eggs and waffles and I had a burger and fries. It was all delicious, but the fries and homefries were UNBELIEVABLE. The ambiance was a little dated, but it was quaint and our server was wonderful. We're going back tomorrow on our way out of town. It was that good.

Very Jersey! Stopped in while visiting with family for a late breakfast. We had pancakes, home fries, toast, eggs, omelets, etc! The staff was very friendly and chatty. The pancakes were amazing! It's been a while since I've had a good pancake. The were fluffy and pillowy with a great flavor. Butter not even necessary! I got grilled toast instead of French toast. This raised some eyebrows and took some explaining, but in the end, they hooked it up. Everyone loved their omelets. No sweet tea for any southerners looking for a taste of home. Atmosphere was very casual and service was pretty quick. Definitely a diner style set up.

Needed a diner before taking train to Jets Game.  Yelp search yielded Tommy's as best choice.  It was worth going out of our way to enjoy the well above average egg dishes and pancakes.  Fast, reasonable, friendly.  What a nice place!
So gross. The bacon was discolored, the bread was cheap, and the pancakes were sad. This whole place is sad and desperately needs a facelift.

I quite like this place. Every dish I've ordered's been solid--from the eggs, to the chicken salad; even the french fries don't disappoint. Friendly and mildly volatile atmosphere! A true Jersey City pre-the-gentrification gem. Hope they stick around; wish they were open later. Waitresses are very nice and not afraid to yell across the restaurant, which really authenticates the Tommy's experience.

Small diner like restaurant. Food was mediocre, service was ok. Breakfast for 2 about $20 including tip for a vegetable omelette, rye toast and potatoes, and an order of pancakes with coffee. Street parking is a nightmare.

This is a great little diner spot! I'm embarrassed to say as a JC-native that this was my first time here. But I'm really glad I came. I ordered the turkey BLT wrap with fries and a slice of the chocolate cream pie. Everything was delicious! The wrap was slightly buttery from toasting it on the grill but it was still pretty dang awesome. Best of all, they weren't stingy with the turkey. The fries were really crispy and perfectly fried! And the chocolate cream pie tasted homemade! Sweet and creamy, but not cloying.My husband usually orders their cheeseburgers or the corned beef hash with eggs, toast and home fries. The burger is cooked well-done but not dry. It's tasty and filling. My husband is not a fan of home fries but I'm sure you can request French fries as a substitute if you're not into that either. The corned beef is really satisfying! It's fresh corned beef, not the canned stuff! My husband's only complaint is that they need to leave it on the griddle for a few minutes longer so there's some crispy bits in there.Maria, the woman who took care of us during my first meal there, was a sweetheart! Can't complain about the service. My husband and I couldn't but help notice that she knew everyone else in the diner. Through the whole meal, people either popped in off of Central just to say hello to her or left bidding Maria a good night or saying "See you tomorrow Maria!" I guess we all want to feel like Norm some of the time.

We ate breakfast here. Super fast service - no wait. Waitress no nonsense but great! Doesn't look like much from the outside but go in - its great. Breakfast very good. Crumb cake is great Too! Good pancakes.
Everything at Tommy's is good, the food. the staff, the atmosphere. The cream of turkey soup is excellant. The food is homemade, just like Mom's kitchen
Delicious breakfast and amazing staff. Will come back to try diner some day with friends and my family. Nice place to sit and enjoy a good fresh meal

Diners that deliver?? YES PLEASE!!Sometimes on a Saturday afternoon in the Heights, when it's cloudy and grey and you don't feel like putting real clothes on there are little miracles. That day Tommy's was my saving grace, bringing me a huge mushroom, onion, cheese omelette with perfectly cooked potatoes and whole wheat toast already buttered. It was a very large omelette and I'm surprised I ate the whole thing. A little on the drier side (hate runny omelettes) onions and mushrooms sautéed and folded into American cheese and egg. And how the potatoes were perfected salted and crunchy I don't know but I loved it. The other lazy person in the room ordered a grill cheese on rye with a side of bacon and I don't think I've ever seen him eat so fast. Nothing fancy about it but when you deliver food that is not soggy or cold and tastes like you were in the restaurant you get good points with me.

I ordered breakfast from here yesterday and everything was perfect. We ordered corn beef hash with eggs over medium and home fries and a bacon egg and cheese on a roll. The portions are satisfying. Delivery was super fast which is a plus and when we got the food itWas still very hot. I will definitely be ordering from them again!

Went a few times, and every time we went: the bacon tasted like it'd been sitting on the grill for a week, the dishware was dirty (crumbs/grease left over), and the wait staff were openly fighting with each other or the kitchen! not to mention that the place looks like it hasn't been cleaned in many years...it's just gross, don't go there.

Been here twice. It's kind of run down but it's got this cozy feeling like you know you're going to get good old diner food. It's a bit dark inside too. I've had both lunch and breakfast. The burger was nothing really special and kind of bland. The breakfast was top notch. Both times the food came out super quick too, ready in just over 5 min. A little over priced for what you're getting but the portions are a nice size.
Great breakfast, quick and tasty. The prices are fair as well. Parking is difficult as you would expect in the heights but if you get there early it's not too bad.

The waiter left and for about 5 minutes we went in noticed.  An older woman came from behind me and asked " what you drinking" as if me seating here was annoying her. She got our drinks and the got who sat is initially must have remembered us and yelled what did we want to drink. I let her know it was being taken care of.  She came back gave us our drinks I ordered French toast eggs hard she abruptly corrected me as if my description was incorrect.  My husband ordered an omelet and he asked for home fries her attitude was nasty she barked they come with fried them and toast what else.  We waited 10 or more minutes for just that, granted there was only one cook not one time did she come back to tell us it'll be ready shortly. She spoke ill of her co-workers to other guest.  By far the worst service I've experienced here.  I can understand maybe the locals or the ppl who frequent like this type of attitude but if she realized according to her that she was too old to be doing this she needs to stop because the way she spoke to customers on the phone and treated us her waitressing days should have been over.  Oh and the food was drenched in grease I had a hair in my eggs , his cheese in his omelet wasn't melted but due to her nasty attitude I wasn't in the mood for more had I complained.

As soon as walked in they seated me right away. You have to try the Greek omelette with extra feta cheese. Soooo goooood.
Great that there is a diner in this part of town, great diner, and unlike most places in the area in that it still gives a lot of food lol.

I got the gyro platter deluxe and the corn beef hash and the food was cooked to perfection.  The lamb was seasoned well and the side salad was soo fresh. The service was friendly and i felt like i was in my own house. The waitress and the cashier greeted me with a smile and made sure my hangover finished course smoothly. HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS PLACE!!

Atmosphere was very casual and service was pretty quick. Definitely a diner style set up.

A true Jersey City pre-the-gentrification gem. Hope they stick around; wish they were open later. Waitresses are very nice and not afraid to yell across the restaurant, which really authenticates the Tommy's experience.

Everything at Tommy's is good, the food. the staff, the atmosphere. The cream of turkey soup is excellant. The food is homemade, just like Mom's kitchen
Delicious breakfast and amazing staff. Will come back to try diner some day with friends and my family. Nice place to sit and enjoy a good fresh meal

That day Tommy's was my saving grace, bringing me a huge mushroom, onion, cheese omelette with perfectly cooked potatoes and whole wheat toast already buttered. It was a very large omelette and I'm surprised I ate the whole thing. A little on the drier side (hate runny omelettes) onions and mushrooms sautéed and folded into American cheese and egg. And how the potatoes were perfected salted and crunchy I don't know but I loved it. The other lazy person in the room ordered a grill cheese on rye with a side of bacon and I don't think I've ever seen him eat so fast. Nothing fancy about it but when you deliver food that is not soggy or cold and tastes like you were in the restaurant you get good points with me.

I ordered breakfast from here yesterday and everything was perfect. We ordered corn beef hash with eggs over medium and home fries and a bacon egg and cheese on a roll. The portions are satisfying. Delivery was super fast which is a plus and when we got the food itWas still very hot. I will definitely be ordering from them again!

Went a few times, and every time we went: the bacon tasted like it'd been sitting on the grill for a week, the dishware was dirty (crumbs/grease left over), and the wait staff were openly fighting with each other or the kitchen! not to mention that the place looks like it hasn't been cleaned in many years...it's just gross, don't go there.
When the cook is swatting flies while cooking your food, and thinks nothing is wrong with that, you know the type of place you're in.

Have been here on a few occasions and they have great food, gracious service and (most importantly when you're hungry!) quick turnaround on your order. Really recommend the patty melt. Gets everything right about the diner experience--a must in New Jersey.

I've only eaten breakfast from Tommy's and must admit, the food is always perfectly cooked and delicious. But then, how much credit do you deserve for getting eggs right?  On the down side, the cook has a tendency to swat flies with the spatula and refuses to put out his cigarettes while cooking. And the pricing is incredibly varied.  It is as though the menu prices are "suggested" verses "as listed."  Expect delivery fees, container fees, utensil fees, etc.

I wanted breakfast for lunch so i called ahead of time to make sure they did....looks tight when you walk in, but what a gold mine of a find for a place to grab great food...alot of space in the back...place had a lot of customers but enough seating to sit more....they had booths to the left, counter seating to the right.....decent prices and great breakfast.... i paid $14.15 i believe for sunny side up eggs,taylor ham,breakfast potatoes,orange juice, toast, and pancakes....ate everything, i dont waste food on this side lol #fatboyproblems...all and all great place to eat local...
I visited this restaurant for the first time and loved it. I loved the staff and the food was really great. Thank you and I will return when I come back to New Jersey

We've enjoyed Tommy's breakfast, lunch and dinners since we moved in the area in 2012. Service is great and it's one of the best diner food we've had. And delivery is fantastic. Whenever we feel too lazy prep breakfast we make a quick call for the farmer's special. So glad to have this spot as an option in the neighborhood.

I love tommys breakfast! I always get their corned beef and hash, it's the best I've ever had! It's a neighborhood place so there are regulars and staff knows a lot of people by first name. They're very friendly, and I love their coffee as well!

If your looking for a fine dining experience then please...skip tommys.  If your looking for delicious food in a real "jersey diner" then this is your place.  Prices are great. Portions are HUGE and the service...well its like being at home being served by your crazy aunt edna.  The food is fresh and delicious.  The dishes are from the 70s lol its awesome.  A great jersey gem that I hope is there for 100 years.

We were traveling to Virginia and didn't want to stop on the highway at the rest area so we checked on Yelp for a good diner. This place was a pleasant surprise. The food was amazing and the staff was friendly. We ordered the omelets but the customers were raving about the French toast . Kind of makes me wish I had ordered that dish. Definitely a don't miss.

I had a bacon&egg cheeseburger from here the other day and it was delicious. The service was excellent; I didn't have to wait long for the food and everyone was really friendly. I would definitely recommend it if you're in the area!

I love diner food was looking forward to ordering delivery from here but the burgers i got were very oversized for the bun and falling out and they were tasteless  - would give another shot and try other food based on others recommendations

Had a great experience here! The staff was incredibly friendly,  breakfast was superb! Spent the last two weeks out of country this was the best choice for a good ole American breakfast! A lot of selections to choose from.  If we're ever back in Jersey my husband and I will be back for sure. P.s try the Taylor ham!!! It's amazing!!! Don't leave with out trying there pie!!!

Woww..  What a NASTY  attitude to the costumers,  I am a waitress and I know it's a hard job but LADIES You need to learn  to deal with people.  I Went a tuesday morning for a coffe with milk (TERRIBLE BY THE WAY).  And the waitress put the coffe on a to go cup.  Without even ask If I wanted to stay... I put her tip on the bar  but she didn't turned to look at at me.  So I took my money  back and i bought  a delicious corn cake, which  wasn't easy to pay because the other blond lady was toooo busy discussing with another customer. I Felt very insulted.
When it comes to breakfast it's one of my fav if you order delivery it always comes so fast or if your going in to have a bite ask for Sandra she will have you laughing the whole time

Great little neighborhood dinner with a great service and excellent food. My favorite breakfast food which I will deny admitting ;) is the eggs and corned beef hash with home fries!  The best thin slices home fries this side of JC!  The corned beef hash is perfectly made on the griddle and NOT greasy!  I've had their panini a as well which are super yum!  And their meatloaf with gravy and mash is a tasty treat as well!  Made Hercules snow storm melt right away!

Really great, traditional diner breakfast. The French toast was fluffy and rich in the perfect way. Home fries are heavenly and omelettes are big. Bacon was perfectly cooked and portions are large (like you expect from a diner.) Have had breakfast sandwiches to go before as well and they are my favorite so far for The Heights. I do have to say that the corned beef hash wasn't ideal- it could have been crispier and more flavorful. The coffee was also less than awesome and for me, at a diner, that is disappointing. Staff is friendly and often humorous. Service is fast and prices are super affordable. Overall I still love the place and will certainly frequent more and recommend to others. Can't wait to try their dinners!

I like the food and delivery is on time. I would have given 4 stars if it were not for the ladies' there. I don't know why they have such nasty attitudes. Also, they are not consistent with pricing. Depends on who takes the order determines what you'll pay for the same items.

Small old school diner vibe in the Heights and they DELIVER!!!!!!!Standard diner fare that you will find anywhere.  The quality of the food is great with prices to match.  The service is almost from another time.  You will be looking for Flo when you walk in there.  Very friendly.I love the Bacon Egg and Cheese sandwiches, the gyros, the burgers, the fries, and my favorite- Meatloaf sandwich......  Pancakes are pretty damn good as well....And if I didn't say it before- THEY DELIVER....  Can't express in words how awesome that is. Have Fun
Couldn't believe I have not been to this place before. Food was super delicious with great price. Service was good. This place will be our go-to diner from now on.

Disappointed I ordered a medium rear steak it was cooked well done it had no seasoning or flavor I asked if they had mixed veggies because on the menu it shows mixed veggies they all started laughing and speaking in another language. The vegetables I did eat were over cooked and brown not appetizing at all with again no flavor and bland. The salad that my meal came with was old and brownish ot looked like it was mixed with new and old lettuce.I gave two stars because I feel bad for the place.

I should've left my positive review when I first came here, and left it at that. Unfortunately, my most recent experience here was not a pleasant one. Let me start off by saying this ... there is nothing wrong with the food here. It's your typical diner menu with everything from subs to pancakes (and everything in between). My fiancé loves the meatloaf. The paninis are pretty good, but I always stick with my disco fries, which are actually pretty great here. I have to give credit where it's due.Now, onto my issue. The service here, or lack thereof, is awful. The staff is friendly for the most part, but unbelievably inattentive. I almost never care about things like this, but it is a serious problem at this joint. I'll make a list:1) We were never given utensils and actually had to remind our waitress to give them to us.2) She never checked to see if we needed drink refills (which we did). In fact, we had to ask the CHEF, because it seemed as if she was actively ignoring us.3) I asked for sauce on the side instead of on the sandwich. She brought it to me and said, "They forgot to put the sauce on the side, but it's okay, right?" (No, it WASN'T okay, and I wish I had the balls to have said so at the time. I knew I wouldn't like the sauce.)4) We asked for the check and she hung behind the counter chatting it up with a coworker instead of bringing it to us. We watched as she continued for talk for about 5 minutes, before my fiancé had enough and got up to request it again.While we are NOT the type of people to not leave a tip, regardless of the circumstances, we were very close that day. To sum it up, I'm not saying that I'll never eat there again (I'm sure I will), but I'll be sure to just have it delivered in the future.

Great no frills diner. After moving to the heights I was craving a good post-hangover diner fix and this place did me right. The food was served fast, the service was friendly, the menu perfectly affordable, and everything was delicious. My roommate orders breakfast from here at least once a weekend and the delivery is super fast.

Meh! that's all I'll say.  I've had better food and service at other joints.  The last time I was there, I found a hair in my toast, brought it to the owner's attention.  She didn't seem concerned or apologetic at all about the finding.  I wasn't offered a clean toast or a credit wasn't even considered.  I am not coming here again, I rather take my business elsewhere.  Bye!
The food is delicious here but I went here on Thursday found a hair in my food and will not go back here. The food is good here but the restaurant is dirty.

Perfect Breakfast!  I never ate a bacon omelette so quickly with fabulous potatoes on the side and buttery toast!!  Staff was great and friendly and brought that check at the end before I asked!!  Can't wait to bring the kiddies with me next time!
I love the coffee in this place. I always eat the egg whites omelette with spinach and cheese. I recommend this place to everyone in jersey city

The food is great! Service is great. The space is kind of small so it is a little tight in there. Do not bring a stroller. One waitress ehhhh. Loud and obnoxious. You come in for a nice weekend breakfast and its just annoying. I find it strange that the manager doesn't say anything about her behavior. But hey I don't own the business so......
Good place to get your diner fix. The food is yummy and the staff are very nice. The coffee is good too. It's a no frills small diner that packs a punch.

A little bit of a greasy spoon in the heights!  I had the veggie omelette (onions, mushrooms, tomatoes) and I added american cheese.  The omelette was a little too over stuffed, but it was still ok.  Served with fries and toast.  Coffee was also good.  The waitresses were of the no nonsense type, but very good.  They checked that we had all our food, and made several refill rounds.  Overall I enjoyed my food and the service and will definitely be back.  Oh, and the mayor was having breakfast at the next table!

I originally gave this restaurant 5 stars but after my second visit I have to lower it one star.  I give the food 5 stars, it's very good diner style food.  As far as the service goes some of the waitresses are too chatty, too slow, and not too polite.  I should not have to chase down a waitress for a check especially when I see her chatting with customers.  Bottom line, 5 stars for the food, 2 stars for the service.  I will come back but order my food to go.

Tommy's is a family restaurant.  You know how sometimes your family makes food that's unimpressive, but simple, and it works?  While arguing in the kitchen about who-knows-what?  That's Tommy's.  This is the kind of place where about half the people coming in the door seem to get a hug.  Where the wait staff remembers what the kids liked last time.  Where the 10 year old coming in the door has baby pictures posted on the wall.  The back half is full of old men who I only assume are widowers, since I've seen them every time I have ever been in, or past, the place.  Like a lot of family restaurants, Tommy's has served as a family for these guys.  That's what a family restaurant does.  Today I watched two older ladies complain about somebody's wife's ravioli for what must have been an hour over 50 cents worth of tea.  Tommy's would never push them out, because this a family restaurant and they respect these ladies.  That's a family restaurant.Tommy's doesn't get five stars for the food.  Or five stars for the service.  Tommy's gets five stars because it's Tommy's.  And just like your grandma, it doesn't matter what you think about Tommy's - it never even crosses your mind to judge it.  You have to love it.
Love the food & they go above and beyond to make sure you are happy with their service when you arent satisfied. Thats what makes customers keep coming back.

Little spot on central ave. Average diner menu options. I've never been during busy hours, but I've eaten in twice and both times I was very happy. First time I had the burger with bacon. I have to say, they nailed the medium rare temperature,  which I didn't think they would. Some of the more sophisticated restaurants I've been too can't even get it right. Second time went for the classic taylor ham, egg, and cheese. They did it with egg whites just like I asked and it was delicious.  Both times service was aloof, yet attentive,  just the way a diner should be.  Space is somewhat small, and if you sit towards the front, you can actually see the cook making the food, which I like. But I know some don't like to sit close to the kitchen. I'm glad I ventured into this little hole in the wall. Great food and nice staff. New breakfast spot, for sure.
A diner.  Waffle was pretty darn good, but suspect I will have to try a sandwich - everyone who came in after we did ordered a breakfast sandwich.

Delicious food, wait times are a bit longer than I would want but I can roll out of bed and have a hearty meal. French toast is amazing and omelette's are well served. Overall I would recommend it, the alternative is The Coachhouse dinner on the JCH border with Union City and I have to drive there because they won't deliver.
great local diner, friendly staff, quick delivery. only wish they made cappuccino.
Great, and fast food!  Can't beat it the price either!  This use to be my spot for breakfast but I am still in town I still go by and catch something to eat!

This little diner is absolutely great! Hole in the wall, small, and so local! Went a few weeks ago and ordered a bacon egg and cheese on a bagel, so good. Will definitely be back to try more of their food!

Tried to go to a couple of the hip breakfast spots in JC but there was no parking, so we ended up here...great food, fair prices, and service was excellent! Definitely check this place out, they do breakfast right...

I visit this place all the time when I'm in town! I recommend this place to anyone that is looking for a friendly staff and super fast service! I highly recommend the paninis. So so good! Thank you Tommy!!
